communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FCC and TCPA Litigator List
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All complaints and any relevant documentation regarding TCPA Litigator List (tcpalitigatorlist.com) in the past two years from November 2022 to November 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael OHare

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Secretary Yellen’s response to Letter to President Joe Biden and Secretary Janet Yellen, Tom Emmer and Members of Congress, November 15th, 2023

It has come to my attention that Secretary Yellen’s response to Congressman Tom Emmer’s Letter to President Joe Biden and Secretary Janet Yellen dated November 15th, 2023 requesting information on Hamas financing through digital assets does not appear to have been made publicly available.

For your convenience, I have attached the letter to which I am seeking Secretary Yellen's response below:
https://emmer.house.gov/_cache/files/3/d/3d43d8c0-a0a8-40ed-864d-059ba2b5a681/CBF7D1BC15D13A231C7270CDD161308D.te.pmc.fh.rt.letter.11.15.23.pdf

I understand that certain portions of the requested information may be exempt from disclosure under FOIA exemptions, such as those concerning national security (5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(1)). If this is the case, I am willing to accept a redacted version of the documents, provided that all reasonably segregable portions of the records are disclosed in accordance with FOIA requirements.

As an independent journalist, I ask that any fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lola Leetz

title: Meetings with Colombian Ambassador to the US Daniel García-Peña regarding Pegasus Sale (U.S. Office of Management and Budget)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list, roster, database, or comparable record of meetings between the Colombian Ambassador to the US Daniel García-Peña and employees, executives, such as but not limited to directors and chiefs of staff, and representatives, such as but not limited to ambassadors, negotiators, special envoys, coordinators and spokespersons regarding Pegasus Spyware and/or NSO Group between July 16, 2024 and November 20, 2024.

Emails, text messages, or comparable records of communication regarding meetings between the Colombian Ambassador to the US Daniel García-Peña and employees, executives, such as but not limited to directors and chiefs of staff, and representatives, such as but not limited to ambassadors, negotiators, special envoys, coordinators and spokespersons regarding Pegasus Spyware and/or NSO Group between July 16, 2024 and November 20, 2024.

Under Executive Order 13526, Section 1.7, classified information that is already publicly available or improperly classified to conceal violations of law, inefficiency, or administrative error cannot be withheld under Exemption 1. The records requested pertain to meetings between Ambassador Daniel García-Peña and senior White House officials regarding NSO Group's Pegasus Spyware and are already in the public domain, as evidenced by the Government of Colombia – for reference, please see the Press Release below. Therefore, the records requested should not be exempted on grounds of national security as they do not pose a risk to national security. 
https://estadosunidos.embajada.gov.co/newsroom/news/embajador-daniel-garcia-pena-se-reunio-con-altos-funcionarios-de-la-casa-blanca-para

As an independent journalist, I ask that any fees be waived. These documents will be made available to the public and are being requested for reporting not commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lola Leetz

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I am requesting access to all records, documents, communications, and materials in the possession of the Department of Justice (DOJ) Civil Rights Division related to Report Number 533252-GXC, submitted on November 9, 2024.

Scope of Request
This request includes but is not limited to:

Internal Correspondence and Documentation

All internal communications, emails, notes, or memoranda discussing or referencing Report Number 533252-GXC.
Any decision-making records explaining the determination to take no further action on the report.
Review and Evaluation Materials

Documents detailing the review process applied to Report Number 533252-GXC.
Criteria, guidelines, or policies used to evaluate the merit of the report.
Related External Communications

Any correspondence between the DOJ and other federal, state, or local agencies referencing Report Number 533252-GXC.
Statistical and Contextual Records

Data or summaries showing how complaints like Report Number 533252-GXC were categorized, including related trends or aggregated analysis.
Policies and Procedures

Internal guidelines or policies governing the Civil Rights Division's handling of reports of civil rights violations similar to this case.
Personnel Assignments

Names, titles, and roles of all individuals involved in the review, evaluation, and disposition of this report.
ADA Accommodations
To ensure full compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, I require the following accommodations:

Communication via MuckRock Platform Only:

All responses must be submitted exclusively through MuckRock, avoiding portals, phone calls, or physical mail.
Accessible Formats:

Provide all records as screen-reader-compatible PDFs.
Simplified Summaries:

For complex records, include simplified summaries to ensure clarity and accessibility.
Detailed Justifications for Redactions or Denials:

Cite specific statutory exemptions under 5 U.S.C. § 552(b) for any withheld or redacted material.
Identification of Responsible Personnel:

Include the names, titles, and contact details of all FOIA officers and personnel involved in the response.
Partial Records as They Become Available:

Provide responsive records as they are located rather than withholding all records until the entire request is processed.
Expedited Processing
This request qualifies for expedited processing under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E) because it concerns significant public interest and addresses systemic civil rights issues with potential societal impact. Delayed access would hinder the public's ability to hold the government accountable and ensure adherence to civil rights protections.

Fee Waiver Request
This request serves the public interest by promoting transparency and accountability within the DOJ's Civil Rights Division. It seeks no commercial benefit and qualifies for a fee waiver under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii).

Timelines and Compliance
FOIA requires a determination within 20 business days. Failure to meet this timeline will prompt escalation to the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) and potential legal remedies under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(B).

If no records exist, please confirm this in writing as required by law.

An estimated completion date as required by 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(7).

title: Michael Kelly Reiner Records (Immigration and Customs Enforcement)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Michael Kelly Reiner Records (Immigration and Customs Enforcement)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please furnish all records including but not limited to any investigative records, reports, notes, documents, logs, recordings, departmental memos, emails, communications or transcripts as to Michael Kelly Reiner (d.o.b.: 06/13/1960; d.o.d.: 06/29/2013, aka the "entire case file." 

For background, Special Agent Angela Hammons, with the US Department of Homeland Security (ICE), as per New York Eastern District Court, Case # 2:2006cr00702, was part of the investigation into Michael Kelly Reiner. On or about August 4, 2006, Michael Kelly Reiner attempted to cross the border from the United States into Canada at the Prescott, Ontario, port of entry. On or about August 8, 2006, Reiner attempted to re-enter the United States from Prescott, Canada at the Odensburg, NY crossing. On or about September 12, 2006, Special Agent Hammons and other agents conducted an interview with Reiner in Long Island.

Reiner was later convicted on or about March 21, 2007 for possession of child pornography as part of a Project Safe Childhood initiative.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lena Ajit

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please furnish all records including but not limited to any investigative records, reports, notes, documents, logs, recordings, departmental memos, emails, communications or transcripts as to Michael Kelly Reiner (d.o.b.: 06/13/1960; d.o.d.: 06/29/2013, aka the "entire case file." 

For background, Special Agent Angela Hammons, with the US Department of Homeland Security (ICE), as per New York Eastern District Court, Case # 2:2006cr00702, was part of the investigation into Michael Kelly Reiner. On or about August 4, 2006, Michael Kelly Reiner attempted to cross the border from the United States into Canada at the Prescott, Ontario, port of entry. On or about August 8, 2006, Reiner attempted to re-enter the United States from Prescott, Canada at the Odensburg, NY crossing. On or about September 12, 2006, Special Agent Hammons and other agents conducted an interview with Reiner in Long Island.

Reiner was later convicted on or about March 21, 2007 for possession of child pornography as part of a Project Safe Childhood initiative.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lena Ajit

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: milwaukee 14 DOJ
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records concerning the Milwaukee Fourteen who were arrested in 1968 for burning draft records. According to the National Archives, these documents might still reside with the Department of Justice. I am interested in the following case files referring to both individual people and the incident in question as well as any other request retained by the DoJ. 

-Case files: 100A-BA-25222 and 100-MW-1581
-case files 146-1-62-564 through 146-1-62-3693 on Donald Joseph Cotton 
-case file 146-1-85-817 on Michael Deans Cullen 
-case file 146-1-85-816 on John Hurbert Higgenbotham 
-case file 146-1-39-1097 on Douglas Ian Marvy 
-case file 146-1-39-1094 on Frederick John Ojile
-case file 25-85-473

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Guariglia

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

FBI records related to a religious cult named the Christ Family, active since the end of the 1960s and based in Hemet (California), and led during his lifetime by an individual named Charles Franklin McHugh, known among his followers as Lightning Amen

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Eugene Abrams Records (Department of Defense, Office of the Inspector General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please furnish all records as to Eugene Abrams (d.o.b. 01/10/1934, d.o.d. 07/17/2023).

Eugene Abrams ran a pornography ring out of his home at 1033 Littleneck Avenue, North Bellmore, NY 11710. Abrams later resided at 6400 Hayes St, Hollywood, FL 33024, 2459 N 37th Ave, Hollywood, FL 33024, and 9195 SE 197th Ave, Ocklawaha, FL 32179. Abrams also worked on several government projects concerning the moon-space project and the anti-ballistic missile early warning system.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lena Ajit

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Delaware Traffic Skims
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

"Traffic skim" model data between each Traffic Analysis Zone (TAZ). This should be a CSV file or Excel spreadsheet with the following columns (and perhaps forecasted data columns for future years)

• Origin zone number
• Destination zone number
• Real automobile distance for the modeled year (in miles)
• Real automobile time for the modeled year (in minutes)

I assume the zones align with this layer: https://enterprise.firstmap.delaware.gov/arcgis/rest/services/Transportation/DE_Boundary_and_Point/MapServer/20

Please provide this in the original machine readable format (CSV, XLSX, SQL, etc.)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware.

communications.subject: RE: FOIA #24-0334/Rudenberg/Traffic Skim Model Data
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Rudenberg,

The Delaware Department of Transportation (“DelDOT”) received your FOIA request, below. It was forwarded to me for research and response. Before I am able to proceed with your request, I will need more information. Can you explain to me what your definition of a “traffic skim” is so that I can understand what your request is and forward it to the appropriate sections.

Thank you,

Shanita Hall
Paralegal III
Legal Department
Department of Transportation
800 Bay Road
P.O. Box 778
Dover, DE 19903

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Davenport Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: Arkansas Department of Corrections Data Request

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Department of Corrections Data Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-101 et seq., I request that the Arkansas Department of Corrections make the below documents available for copying or inspection. 

Please provide data sufficient to identify each person currently incarcerated in an Arkansas Division of Correction (“ADC”) facility based on a parole revocation. This includes any existing data compilation, including but not limited to any existing rosters of currently incarcerated people, that contains the following information: 

1) Name; 
2) ADC number; 
3) Admission date; 
4) Reason for admission; 
5) Current facility; and 
6) Projected release date. 

I ask that the Board provide the above records within three business days of receipt of this request, as required by Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-105(e). I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. I also ask that the Board provide me with a fee estimate prior to fulfilling any request. 

Should any part of the above request be denied, I request the Board provide a written response citing the specific statutory exemption, as required by Ark. Code. Ann. § 25-19-105(a)(3). If some of the above records are disclosable and others exempt, please provide the disclosable documents and provide the exemption(s) preventing disclosure of the rest per Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-105(f). If any of the above documents are administratively controlled by a different custodian than the Board, I ask that the Board please provide those custodians’ information, per Ark. Code. Ann. § 25-19-105(a)(3)(C).   

Please note that I am a citizen of Arkansas, and I am using MuckRock’s services to help manage and track my request. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Matthew.

communications.subject: RE: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Department of Corrections Data Request
communications.communication:
Sonny Albarado,

The Arkansas Department of Corrections received your request below.  The information that you are seeking can be found on the Department's website via this link, https://apps.ark.org/inmate_info/index.php.
Via the link, you can select "Probation Revocation" as the Offense Category and it will show a list of inmates that includes the information that you requested below.


Thank you,
LATISHA MEADOWS
Quality Assurance Coordinator
Arkansas Department of Corrections
Phone: 1-501-537-7677
Email: Latisha.Meadows@doc.arkansas.gov<mailto:Latisha.Meadows@doc.arkansas.gov>
